title: Nudos y Superficies
authors:
Yoseth Arciniegas Barreto, Nicol Bermudez Bohorquez, Juanita
  Pinz\'on-Caicedo, Luisa Rozo Posada
abstract:
These notes are an introduction to knot theory from the perspective of
surfaces. The notes cover fundamental concepts such as isotopies, Reidemeister
moves, torus knots, and (orientable, connected) surfaces with one boundary
component. They also present knot invariants defined through Seifert surfaces
and their associated matrices, including the 3-genus, the Alexander polynomial,
and the signature. Finally, starting from the notion of concordance and the
connected sum operation, a group structure on the set of knots is introduced.
